emotional_core: Hidden courage â€” being brave even when scared

cards.emotional_hook_en: Have you ever had to be really, REALLY brave? Today we meet a queen with a big secret!
cards.symbol_description: A golden crown with a subtle Star of David woven into its design, glowing softly. Represents Esther's hidden Jewish identity beneath her royal role.
cards.image_prompt:
A golden crown sitting on a royal purple velvet cushion, center-low in the frame.
A subtle Star of David is woven into the crown's design, glowing softly.
Sparkles and gentle light rays around the crown.
Above the crown: deep royal purple sky fading to warm amber, with scattered stars.

Magical, mysterious, wonder. The crown glows with hidden meaning.
cards.teacher_script: Today we're going to hear an amazing story. It's about a queen named Esther who had a BIG secret. She was Jewish â€” just like us! â€” but nobody knew. When her people needed help, she had to be SO brave. Let's find out what happened!

cards.character_description_en: Esther was a young Jewish woman who became the queen. She kept her Jewish identity a secret. When her people needed help, she found her courage.
cards.image_prompt:
ESTHER:
Young Jewish woman, warm olive skin, large kind brown eyes.
Long dark hair with elegant modest head covering.
Royal purple and blue flowing dress, simple gold tiara.
Gentle, brave expression.

Esther portrait framed from chest up, face centered in the frame.
Palace archways and golden ceiling visible above her head, fading into warm shadow.
She has a gentle but determined expression â€” kind and brave.
Warm golden light from the right side. Dark shadow pooling in the lower-left.

Warm, regal, kind. She's someone children will root for.
cards.teacher_script: This is Esther. She became the queen! But she had a secret â€” she was Jewish, and nobody in the palace knew. Esther was nervous about her secret. But guess what? When it really mattered, she was SO brave. She's our hero!

cards.character_description_en: Mordechai was Esther's older cousin. He raised her and always gave her good advice. He stood up for what was right, no matter what.
cards.image_prompt:
MORDECHAI:
Older Jewish man, warm brown skin, kind wise eyes.
Full gray-brown beard, dignified posture.
Jewish head covering (kippah or cloth wrap).
Modest robes in earth tones - browns, creams, subtle blues.

Mordechai portrait framed from chest up, face centered in the frame.
City gate archway visible above his head, with blue sky and warm light beyond.
He has knowing eyes and a grandfatherly smile.
Warm earth-toned light. Dark stone wall fading into shadow at the lower-left.

Wise, warm, protective. A grandfather figure children can trust.
cards.teacher_script: This is Mordechai. He's like a wise uncle or grandpa. He helped raise Esther and always knew what to do. Mordechai was very brave too â€” he wouldn't bow down to anyone except God. He helped Esther be brave!

cards.character_description_en: Haman worked for the king. He wanted everyone to bow down to him. When Mordechai wouldn't bow, Haman felt very jealous.
cards.teaching_moment_en: Sometimes when we feel jealous, we want to do something mean. But that's not a good choice. We can talk about our feelings instead.
cards.image_prompt:
HAMAN:
Adult man with DARK POINTED GOATEE WITH CONNECTED MUSTACHE.
DISTINCTIVE THREE-CORNERED HAT (like hamantaschen pastry shape).
Pouty frustrated expression, furrowed brow (NOT scary).
Persian clothing in MUTED dusty purple and gray.
Arms crossed, looking jealous and annoyed.

Haman portrait framed from chest up, face centered in the frame.
Muted palace courtyard visible above â€” washed-out dusty arches and pale sky.
He's frowning with arms crossed, looking away to the right.
Muted, desaturated colors throughout. Dark ground shadow at lower-left.

Jealous and pouty. Not scary â€” just someone who needs to learn.
cards.teacher_script: This is Haman. He worked for the king and wanted everyone to bow down to him. But Mordechai said no â€” he only bows to God. That made Haman feel SO jealous. His jealousy grew and grew... and he made a very bad choice. Have you ever felt jealous? It's okay to feel that way, but Haman didn't make good choices with his feelings.

cards.character_description_en: King Achashverosh ruled a very big kingdom. He didn't always think before he decided things. He listened to Haman without asking enough questions.
cards.teaching_moment_en: It's important to think before we decide. We should ask questions and not just say yes right away.
cards.image_prompt:
KING ACHASHVEROSH:
Adult man with confused, distracted expression.
Large ornate crown (slightly too big, tilted for comic effect).
Fancy royal robes â€” rich purples, golds, deep reds.
Big bushy beard, wide confused eyes.

King Achashverosh portrait framed from chest up, face centered in the frame.
Opulent throne room ceiling with gold and jewels visible above his head.
His crown tilts slightly. He scratches his head with a bewildered look.
Rich warm light from chandeliers above. Dark throne room shadow at lower-left.

Bumbling, confused, but not mean. A king who needs help making good choices.
cards.teacher_script: This is King Achashverosh. He was the king! But you know what? He didn't always stop to think. When Haman told him a bad plan, the king just said yes without asking questions. That wasn't smart! We should always think first and ask questions. But don't worry â€” the king learns his lesson!

cards.description_en: The king chose Esther to be his new queen. She moved into the beautiful palace. But she kept her secret â€” she didn't tell anyone she was Jewish.
cards.roleplay_prompt: Act it out: Put an imaginary crown on your head and give a royal wave!
cards.image_prompt:
ESTHER:
Young Jewish woman, warm olive skin, large kind brown eyes.
Long dark hair with elegant modest head covering.
Royal purple and blue flowing dress, simple gold tiara.

Esther in the palace, wearing or receiving her crown. Scene in center-right of frame.
She looks beautiful but slightly nervous â€” this is a big moment!
Warm palace interior with tall pillars and soft golden light.
High vaulted ceiling visible above, fading into warm amber haze.
Dark marble floor with shadow pooling in the lower-left corner.

Magical, exciting, but with a hint of nervousness. A new chapter begins.
cards.teacher_script: The king needed a new queen, and he chose Esther! She was so beautiful and kind. She moved into the big palace and wore a shiny crown. But Esther had a secret â€” shhh! â€” she didn't tell anyone she was Jewish. Let's all put on our pretend crowns and wave like Queen Esther!

cards.description_en: Haman wanted everyone to bow down to him. But Mordechai said no! He stood tall and would not bow.
cards.roleplay_prompt: Act it out: Stand up straight and tall! Shake your head NO!
cards.image_prompt:
MORDECHAI:
Older Jewish man, warm brown skin, kind wise eyes.
Full gray-brown beard, dignified posture.
Jewish head covering. Modest robes in earth tones.

HAMAN:
Adult man with DARK POINTED GOATEE WITH CONNECTED MUSTACHE.
DISTINCTIVE THREE-CORNERED HAT (like hamantaschen).
Pouty frustrated expression. Muted dusty purple clothing.

Mordechai standing tall and dignified at the city gates, center-right of frame.
Haman passing by on the left, looking frustrated that Mordechai won't bow.
Mordechai's posture is proud but peaceful â€” not aggressive.
Tall stone gate archway rises above them into blue sky.
Dark ground and shadow in the lower-left corner.

Dignified courage. Mordechai stands for what's right, calmly and firmly.
cards.teacher_script: Haman walked through the streets and wanted everyone to bow down to him. But when he passed Mordechai, guess what happened? Mordechai stood up TALL. He shook his head and said NO! Mordechai only bows to God. Let's all stand up tall like Mordechai! Stand straight... now shake your head NO!

cards.description_en: Haman felt SO jealous that Mordechai wouldn't bow. His jealousy grew bigger and bigger. He made a plan to hurt all the Jewish people. That was wrong!
cards.roleplay_prompt: Act it out: Make a jealous, pouty face and cross your arms!
cards.image_prompt:
HAMAN:
Adult man with DARK POINTED GOATEE WITH CONNECTED MUSTACHE.
DISTINCTIVE THREE-CORNERED HAT (like hamantaschen).
Pouty frustrated expression (NOT scary or angry).
Persian clothing in MUTED dusty purple and gray.

Haman sitting alone in a room, looking jealous and making a bad plan. Center-right of frame.
His expression is pouty â€” like a child who didn't get their way.
Small crumpled papers scattered around him.
Muted, washed-out room with dusty arched ceiling above.
Dark floor and shadow in the lower-left corner.

A cautionary moment. "This is what jealousy does." Not frightening â€” just sad.
cards.teacher_script: Uh oh. Haman was SO jealous and angry that Mordechai wouldn't bow. His jealousy grew and grew until he made a VERY bad choice. He decided he wanted to hurt all the Jewish people! That was SO wrong. Can you make a jealous, pouty face like Haman? Cross your arms... Now â€” is that a good choice? NO! Haman needed to stop and think.

cards.description_en: Mordechai told Esther about Haman's bad plan. Esther was scared, but she knew what she had to do. She went to the king and told him her secret!
cards.roleplay_prompt: Act it out: Take a deep breath and say 'I have something important to tell you!'
cards.image_prompt:
ESTHER:
Young Jewish woman, warm olive skin, large kind brown eyes.
Long dark hair with elegant modest head covering.
Royal purple and blue flowing dress, simple gold tiara.

ACHASHVEROSH:
Adult man, large ornate crown, fancy royal robes.
Big bushy beard, wide eyes.

Esther taking a deep breath, gathering courage. She's center-right in the frame.
Approaching the grand throne room â€” standing before the king.
Her expression shows determination despite fear. Hand over heart.
King Achashverosh visible on his throne to the left, looking surprised.
Grand throne room with high ceiling and dramatic light shafts from above.
Dark floor in the lower-left corner.

The climax! Tension and courage. Esther's bravest moment.
cards.teacher_script: Mordechai ran to tell Esther about Haman's terrible plan. Esther was scared â€” really scared! But she knew she had to help. She took a deep breath and went to see the king. Then she said the bravest words: 'I have something important to tell you. I am Jewish!' Let's practice being brave like Esther. Take a deep breath... now say 'I have something important to tell you!'

cards.description_en: The king listened to Esther. He stopped Haman's bad plan! All the Jewish people were saved, and everyone celebrated!
cards.roleplay_prompt: Act it out: Jump up and cheer! The Jewish people were saved!
cards.image_prompt:
ESTHER:
Young Jewish woman, warm olive skin, large kind brown eyes.
Long dark hair with elegant modest head covering.
Royal purple and blue flowing dress, simple gold tiara. Joyful expression.

MORDECHAI:
Older Jewish man, warm brown skin, kind wise eyes.
Full gray-brown beard. Jewish head covering.
Modest robes in earth tones.

Celebration! Esther and Mordechai together in center-right foreground, smiling hugely.
Jewish people in background cheering, hands raised.
Confetti and festive streamers. Bright, warm colors everywhere.
Bright sky or festive canopy visible above. Dark festive ground at lower-left.

PURE JOY! The payoff â€” let kids feel the celebration!
cards.teacher_script: When the king heard Esther's secret, he was so surprised! He loved Queen Esther. He stopped Haman's bad plan right away. The Jewish people were SAVED! Everyone was SO happy! They celebrated and danced and cheered! Let's celebrate too â€” jump up and down and cheer! YAY!

questions.question_en: Have you ever had to be brave, even when you were scared?
How do you think Esther felt before she told her secret?
What helps YOU feel brave when you're scared?

cards.torah_talk_instruction: Sit in a circle and share!
cards.image_prompt:
Diverse illustrated children sitting in a circle on a colorful rug, seen from slightly above.
Thoughtful, sharing expressions. Warm classroom or living room setting.
Some children with hands raised, others listening carefully.
The scene fills the upper two-thirds. Colorful rug and warm floor visible below.

Safe, warm, inclusive. A cozy circle where everyone's feelings matter.
cards.teacher_script: Esther was really scared, but she was brave anyway. Let's sit in a circle and talk about being brave. Have YOU ever had to be brave, even when you were scared? Maybe speaking up, or trying something new? What helps you feel brave? Let's share with each other!

questions.question_en: Have you ever had a secret that was hard to keep?
How do you think Esther felt keeping her secret?
Who do you talk to when something feels too big to hold inside?

cards.torah_talk_instruction: Sit in a circle and share!
cards.image_prompt:
A child looking thoughtful, maybe hugging a stuffed animal.
Sitting on a soft cushion or window seat, seen from slightly above.
Warm light coming in from a window. Soft, cozy feeling.
The child is in the upper portion. Soft floor or cushion visible below.

Gentle, safe. It's okay to have big feelings.
cards.teacher_script: Esther had to keep a big secret for a long time. That can feel hard! Have you ever had a secret that felt too big to hold inside? Sometimes we need to talk to a grown-up we trust. Who do you talk to when you have big feelings? Let's share in our circle.

cards.story_connection_en: Haman made a very bad choice because of his jealousy. Every year when we hear his name, we make noise to 'blot it out!'
cards.practice_description_en: When someone reads the Purim story out loud, we listen carefully. Every time we hear 'Haman,' we shake our groggers as loud as we can!
cards.child_action_en: Can you shake a grogger? Let's practice together â€” when I say 'Haman,' shake as loud as you can!
cards.image_prompt:
Family or community gathered in a warm synagogue, grounded in the lower portion of the frame.
A friendly adult (generic, NOT a story character) reading from a scroll (megillah).
Children in foreground happily shaking colorful groggers (noisemakers).
Warm golden ceiling lights and festive decorations hanging above.
Golden ambient glow and warm ceiling space above the people.

Joyful community celebration! The fun of making noise together.
cards.teacher_script: Remember how Haman made such a bad choice? Every year, when we read the Purim story and hear his name, we make LOTS of noise! We use a special noisemaker called a grogger. Can you say that? Gro-gger! It sounds like this â€” [shake grogger]. Let's practice! When I say 'Haman'... everyone shake! Ready? HAMAN! [let kids shake] Great job! That's how we celebrate Purim!

cards.story_connection_en: Esther kept who she really was hidden, like a costume. On Purim, we dress up to remember her brave secret.
cards.practice_description_en: On Purim, everyone wears costumes! We can dress up as queens, kings, heroes, or anything we want!
cards.child_action_en: If you could wear any costume for Purim, what would you be? A queen? A superhero? Something silly?
cards.image_prompt:
Children dressed in colorful Purim costumes, grounded in the lower portion of the frame.
A mix: someone dressed as a queen, a superhero, maybe an animal.
Joyful expressions, showing off costumes to each other.
Festive streamers and balloons hanging from above. Golden warm glow at the top.

Fun, festive, imaginative! Celebrates creativity and joy.
cards.teacher_script: Remember how Esther kept her Jewish identity hidden? It was like she was wearing an invisible costume! On Purim, we wear REAL costumes to remember Esther's secret. Some people dress as queens and kings. Some dress as animals or superheroes. Some wear silly costumes! If YOU could wear any Purim costume, what would you be? Let's share our ideas!

cards.story_connection_en: When the Jewish people were saved, they wanted to share their joy! They gave food and treats to their friends and neighbors.
cards.practice_description_en: On Purim, we make gift baskets filled with yummy treats. We give them to friends to spread happiness!
cards.child_action_en: Can you help make a gift basket for someone you care about?
cards.image_prompt:
Child handing a colorful gift basket to a friend at their door. Scene grounded low in the frame.
Basket filled with treats â€” hamantaschen visible, fruits, wrapped goodies.
Both children smiling warmly. Warm home setting with a doorway.
Warm golden light from above â€” porch light or sunshine. Open sky or warm glow above.

Generous, warm, sharing joy with others.
cards.teacher_script: When the Jewish people were saved, they were SO happy! They wanted to share that happy feeling with everyone. So they gave gifts of food to their friends and neighbors. On Purim, we do the same thing! We make baskets with treats and give them to people we care about. Who would YOU like to give a gift basket to?

cards.example_sentence_en: Esther was a gibor â€” she was brave even when she was scared!
cards.kid_friendly_explanation_en: A gibor is someone who does the right thing, even when it's hard or scary. YOU can be a gibor too!
cards.image_prompt:
ESTHER:
Young Jewish woman, warm olive skin, large kind brown eyes.
Long dark hair with elegant modest head covering.
Royal purple and blue flowing dress, simple gold tiara.

Esther standing tall and brave in a heroic low-angle shot, looking slightly up at her.
She's in the center-lower portion of the frame, looking determined and strong.
Bright sky or warm golden radiance above her. Rays of light behind her.
She looks like a hero â€” confident, powerful, courageous.

Empowering! YOU can be brave too! Strength and courage.
cards.teacher_script: Let's learn a special Hebrew word: GIBOR. Can you say it? Gi-bor! It means 'hero' or 'brave one.' Esther was a gibor because she did the right thing even when she was scared. Guess what? YOU can be a gibor too! When you help someone, or try something new, or stand up for what's right â€” that's being a gibor. Let's all say it: 'I am a gibor!'
